title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Belching Disorders
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Belching Disorders provides criteria for diagnosis of excessive supragastric or gastric belching.

orgreference.text: Stanghellini V, Chan FK, Hasler WL, et al. Gastroduodenal Disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150(6):1380-92.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for belching disorders,* patient must have the following (for 3 months prior with symptom onset ≥6 months ago):

  1. Excessive supragastric belching: Bothersome (i.e., severe enough to impact on usual activities) belching from the esophagus more than 3 days a week.

  2. Excessive gastric belching: Bothersome (i.e., severe enough to impact on usual activities) belching from the stomach more than 3 days a week.

*Note:

  1. Supragastric belching is supported by observing frequent, repetitive belching.

  2. Gastric belching has no established clinical correlate.

  3. Objective intraluminal impedance measurement can be used to distinguish supragastric from gastric belching.
